Building a Side Hustle

  1. Dashboard
  2. Select Option
College is the perfect time to develop your entrepreneurial endeavors. While a startup might not be for you, you can still develop income streams while making high marks on your grades. Here are a few ways you can do just that:

1. Market your skills:

If you have a specific skill, say videography, or fixing bikes or cars, you can leverage that into a small business. Spend a little time to create brand for yourself, and start putting yourself and your products/services out there on the market. Forbes has a great article on developing a marketing strategy, no matter what level your business is at. Click Here So say you don't have a particular skill that other people find valuable, with a little intiative, you can develop whichever skill you want. There are so many sites and apps like Youtube, Udemy and LinkedIn Learning that have literally thousands of courses on just about anything.

Odd Jobs

Ok so maybe going the skills route just isnt quite right for you at this point in your life. There are still options for you to develop alternate streams of income that work with the student lifestyle. Here are just a few ideas: 1. Tutor 2. Sell your old textbooks 3. Drive Uber and Lyft 4. Become a Mystery Shopper 5. Pet Sit or Baby Sit This site has a slew of ideas
